channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Asian chip stocks mostly rise, shrugging off new U.S. semiconductor export curbs on China
item.description: Shares of major Asian chip stocks mostly rose on Tuesday, shrugging off the U.S. announcing new emiconductor export controls on China.

item.title: China's AI balancing act — beating the U.S. but keeping the tech from threatening Beijing's rule
item.description: Prominent AI scientist Max Tegmark said the narrative of a geopolitical battle between the U.S. and China racing to build the smartest AI is a "suicide race."

item.title: Trump repeats vow to 'block' Nippon Steel's bid for U.S. Steel
item.description: While he made similar statements on the 2024 campaign trail, it was the first time that Trump had spoken about the deal since he won a second presidential term last month.

item.title: South Korea's inflation climbs in November, but misses expectations
item.description: Last week, the bank of Korea cut its headline inflation outlook for 2024 and 2025 to 2.3% and 1.9% respectively, down from 2.5% and 2.1%.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Investors are filled with the holiday spirit
item.description: Investors are still buzzing with positive sentiment, pushing stocks up to new records, but some analysts are concerned the good feelings are on frail footing.

item.title: Art Cashin, New York Stock Exchange fixture for decades, dies at age 83
item.description: Art Cashin was UBS' director of floor operations at the NYSE and a man The Washington Post called "Wall Street's version of Walter Cronkite."

item.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk loses bid to get $56 billion pay package reinstated
item.description: Elon Musk's pay package granted in 2018 was the largest compensation plan in U.S. history for a public company executive.

item.title: Jaguar reveals 'Type 00' concept car, first under controversial new brand identity
item.description: Famed British carmaker Jaguar revealed its new vehicle design direction Monday night with the introduction of an all-electric concept car called "Type 00."

item.title: Visiting Europe's Christmas markets? Here's how to do it — via a river cruise
item.description: A river cruise is a convenient way to explore some of the oldest and most famous Christmas markets in Europe, writes contributor Penny Sadler.

item.title: Fed Governor Waller says he is 'leaning toward' a December rate cut, but worries about inflation
item.description: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller cited recent data indicating that progress on inflation may be "stalling."

item.title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger ousted by board after disastrous performance
item.description: Intel announced Monday that CEO Pat Gelsinger has retired from the company, effective Dec. 1.

item.title: GM to sell stake in battery cell plant to joint venture partner for roughly $1 billion
item.description: General Motors plans to sell its stake in a $2.6 billion electric vehicle battery cell plant in Michigan to its joint venture partner LG Energy Solution.

item.title: France's prime minister to push through contested budget despite risk of no-confidence vote
item.description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier on Monday opted to push through a contested budget bill without a vote in parliament.

item.title: Ireland's election delivers pro-business continuity despite voter discontent
item.description: The result shows Ireland is "still open to global companies, and as pro-business as it has been for the last 30 or 40 years."

item.title: Trump's Defense pick, Pete Hegseth, faces new media report on alleged alcohol abuse, sexual impropriety
item.description: Former Fox News host Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of Defense, was investigated in 2017 for an alleged sexual assault.

item.title: Norway hits pause on controversial deep-sea mining plans
item.description: Norway has shelved plans to open a vast ocean area at the bottom of the Arctic for commercial-scale deep-sea mining.

item.title: Streamer Kai Cenat earns millions, breaks Twitch subscriber record during 30-day livestream
item.description: Kai Cenat, a 22-year-old live streamer, completed a so-called subathon on Saturday, streaming 24 hours a day for the entire 30 days of November.

item.title: Strikes underway at Volkswagen plants across Germany as wage conflict escalates
item.description: Volkswagen plants saw workers go on warning strikes on Monday as tensions over changes to labor agreements and potential factory closures escalated.

item.title: Super Micro pops nearly 30% after special committee finds no 'evidence of misconduct'
item.description: Shares of Super Micro Computer surged more than 30% after a special committee ruled it found "no evidence of misconduct" at the embattled AI server maker.

item.title: Chinese automakers BYD, Leapmotor and Xiaomi smash annual delivery targets ahead of schedule
item.description: The Chinese automakers have raced past their annual delivery targets a month ahead of schedule, underscoring their rapid growth and strong market demand.

item.title: Why Amazon sellers and retailers are flocking to TikTok Shop despite looming U.S. ban
item.description: Despite a looming ban, TikTok is making inroads in e-commerce, poaching both talent and sellers from Amazon.

item.title: Coinbase policy chief expects speedy approval of crypto laws following Trump's victory
item.description: Crypto legislation should make its way through Congress "fairly quickly" after Donald Trump's election win, according to Coinbase's chief policy officer.

item.title: China bonds rally with 10-year yield hitting a multi-decade low on rate cut expectations
item.description: China bonds rallied Monday with the 10-year yield dropping below the key psychological level of 2% to hit a multi-decade low.

item.title: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares resigns amid problems in U.S., falling sales
item.description: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has unexpectedly resigned from the automaker amid increasingly "different views" between the executive and the board of directors.

item.title: Caixin PMI: China’s November factory growth hits five-month high, beats forecasts
item.description: Manufacturers saw incoming new orders rise at its fastest pace in more than three years, signaling that stimulus efforts have already seeped into the economy.

item.title: Adani investor GQG's shares plunge over 15% after UBS downgrades stock, cuts target price
item.description: UBS also cut its target price on the firm from AU$3.30 to AU$2.30, and this marks the Swiss bank's first ever downgrade of the stock since its listing.

item.title: Elon Musk asks court to block OpenAI from converting to a for-profit
item.description: Elon Musk seeks to block OpenAI from changing its business structure, and discouraging deals to back competitors like xAI.

item.title: How Trump's mass deportation plan can use AI to extend immigration crackdown
item.description: AI is already being used at the U.S.-Mexico border to enforce homeland security. Trump's mass deportation plan will likely expand that well beyond the border.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts pick 3 stocks for their attractive prospects
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service pinpoints Wall Street's best-performing stocks, including ServiceNow and Snowflake.

item.title: I'm a travel writer who has visited 68 countries—the 4 'magical places' I think about moving to most
item.description: "I wonder what it would be like to live in most of the places I visit," says Chicago-based writer Meena Thiruvengadam. Here are my top four.
